text: Hello Everyone, When I created an html email module, is there a way to display the element in the description separate by comma into a list with ul li ? {{ module.product_field.properties.description }}
The problem is that the description is written into one single line and I need for each element separated by a comma to be in a list
Hi everyone! just want to ask, are there any workaround to disable the days that are not in the specified date range?
To clarify - You would like to specify a time period for which days can't be selected?
This means that from 4/9 to 4/11 should be disable in the date picker?
No <@U05R380MLMC> what I want to happen is that the specified range date will be the available dates, and the rest will be disabled.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Lead-Capture-Tools/Date-picker-Specific-date-range/m-p/831298> - similar to this post

I'm pretty sure your screenshot accomplishes this.  The date property will only allow the dates from 4/9 to 4/11 be selected.

The text above it says "What dates are allowed for this property?" and you have configured it to use a custom date range
If after configuring the field, you go to the field on the record, and try to select a date outside that range. If you are able to, then I'd say open a ticket with HubSpot support.
The problem is I can select the outside dates on the page.
Is the field being displayed on a public facing webform? or the field will be used internally on a company/contact object?
This is the field that will be used on a form, which will be shown on the page. <@U05R380MLMC>
From the screenshot, these dates look unselectable.  Are you sure that you can submit the webform using a date outside your range?
I would proceed with building your form and trying to submit the data to see if any validation takes place when submit happens

Actually the past dates and the dates that are not within the date range I added on the property settings are still selectable. Also, the submission pushes through even tho I selected a date that is not in the range of the specified date.
Got it - I just ready the link you sent me and the corresponding documentation
yeah seems like it's not possible as of the moment, I'm hoping to have some answers from the other devs if they some workaround on this problem.
The workaround for this is to program your own HTML form and validation rules and then use the HubSpot API to send the data.

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form?_ga=2.205538970.880249983.1709099051-58972156.1709099051&_gl=1*js65w2*_ga*NTg5NzIxNTYuMTcwOTA5OTA1MQ..*_ga_LXTM6CQ0XK*MTcwOTA5OTA1MS4xLjEuMTcwOTA5OTA2Mi40OS4wLjA>.
I was thinking if there's an API to fetch the specified date range in date picker property
oh nvm I see it alread
thanks for the help <@U05R380MLMC>
Best of luck to you! If you need help setting up a custom form with date validation  or anything HS related - feel free to reach out.
